text: The EF55-200mm refers to two telephoto zoom lenses produced by Canon. They are of the EF lens mount that is compatible with the EOS line of cameras. The two versions are: *4.5-5.6 *4.5-5.6 II ==Lenses== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- ! Attribute !4.5-5.6 !4.5-5.6 II |- ! Image stabilizer |colspan=2 |- ! Ring USM |colspan=2 |- ! L-series |colspan=2 |- ! Diffractive Optics |colspan=2 |- ! Ultra-low dispersion glass element |colspan=2 |- ! Synthetic Fluorite glass element |colspan=2 |- ! Macro |colspan=2 |- ! Short back focus |colspan=2 |- ! Maximum aperture | colspan=2| 4.5-5.6 |- ! Minimum aperture | 22-27 | 22-27 (1/3-stop increments is 22-29) |- ! Weight | colspan=2| |- ! Max. Diameter x Length | colspan=2| x |- ! Filter diameter | colspan=2| 52 mm |- ! Groups/elements | colspan=2| 13/13 |- ! # of diaphragm blades | colspan=2| 6 |- ! Closest focusing distance | colspan=2| |- ! Currently in production? |colspan=2 |- ! Release date | March 1998 | September 2003 |} ==References== *EF55-200mm f/4.5-5.6 USM at the Canon Camera Museum *EF55-200mm f/4.5-5.6 II USM at the Canon Camera Museum 55-200mm
title: Canon EF 55–200mm lens
